While I'm working in the Senate to support unions, I also want to make sure they're able to fight for themselves. We need to expand collective bargaining rights so unions can do what they do best: lead the way in the fight for dignity for workers.

I’m also pushing for investments in manufacturing, clean energy, & innovative transportation solutions. Nevada is the #InnovationState, and we’re building the economy of the 21st century because it’s good for both our environment & our state's economy.

1 of my priorities in the Senate is to make sure we keep good paying jobs here in the US. I’m going to oppose trade deals that lack strong union-supported protections for American jobs. We shouldn’t be trying to grow our economy at the expense of our workers.

The census determines how many House representatives each state gets & how voting district boundaries are drawn. Businesses also use census data to determine where to expand operations. There’s too much at stake to let rural communities be undercounted in #Census2020.

The Constitution requires a census each decade to count every person living in America, but too often rural communities are overlooked & undercounted. NV is among the states at greatest risk of an undercount in #Census2020 according to @urbaninstitute https://www.urban.org/research/publication/assessing-miscounts-2020-census …

It’s critical that our rural communities are counted in #Census2020. From representation in government, to federal funding and economic growth, Nevada’s rural communities can’t be overlooked or undercounted. Read more here ⤵️ https://elynews.com/2019/08/23/rural-communities-rely-on-an-accurate-2020-census/ …

I’m continuing to fight for Nevadans who expect common sense from their government and for a bipartisan solution that ends the Trump shutdown.
Americans deserve better than the uncertainty and disruption of the Trump shutdown. They deserve a government that puts their interests first and works together to find solutions.
President Trump caved to the demands of his rightwing critics and put partisan politics above the best interests of Americans by triggering a partial government shutdown.

I cannot take a salary during a government shutdown knowing that so many federal workers in Nevada and across the country will go without pay. I’ll be donating my salary to a Nevada charity for every day of the Trump shutdown.
Sadly, President Trump has brought our country into yet another crisis right before the holidays. We should be working together to end to this shutdown.
We must remain committed to protecting the border through the use of new technology and updating existing infrastructure, while holding this administration accountable.

According to a GAO report, Customs and Border Protection has not even studied the effectiveness of new barriers or their estimated costs – a potential waste of billions in taxpayer dollars and opening up the process to graft and mismanagement without proper oversight.

Democrats support border security – we always have, but we will not sit idly by while President Trump manufactures a crisis and wastes billions of American taxpayer dollars. He must work to find common ground and sign a bipartisan compromise that both Ds and Rs can agree to.

The Senate has worked together in a bipartisan way to get the funds necessary for the DHS to do their job and protect Americans. Our bipartisan legislation includes funding for programs that truly protect Americans and strengthen the southern border.

The challenges our state faces are many & great, but I believe we’re up to the task. I look forward to fighting alongside the Nevada Legislature, @GovSisolak & our constitutional officers to do right by Nevadans. Because when Nevadans have a fair shot at success, Nevada thrives.

If working families in Nevada are to have a fair shot, we must address the lack of affordable housing. Affordable housing is key to providing stability and economic security for Nevada families, allowing them to build wealth and plan for the future.

I recognize that rapid economic growth comes with growing pains for our state. That’s why we’re working together to find innovative solutions to one of Nevada’s greatest challenges: ensuring hardworking families in our state can afford to live in their communities.

I’ve developed legislation & fought for opportunities that encourage the development of smart tech, expand access to broadband in underserved communities, and put guardrails in place to protect workers & ensure the responsible use of tech that continues to diversify our economy.

Nevada is a leader in innovation. In the Senate, I’ve introduced legislation that ensures we continue to see strong economic development and job creation for Nevadans. My agenda is based on what I’ve seen right here in Nevada. I call it the Innovation State Initiative.

We’re working across all levels of gov't to address the root cause of natural disasters: climate change. Whether it’s strengthening partnerships to protect Tahoe or advancing renewable energy, we'll continue to prioritize conservation while creating good-paying jobs for Nevadans.

A healthy NV also means protecting our environment. There’s no better example of our collaboration than our unified response to the Admin’s decision to ship plutonium to the state. And when it comes to Yucca Mountain, we’ll continue working together to make sure it stays dead.

I’m committed to continuing to fight by your side to improve the Affordable Care Act and expand the number of health care options available to patients and families, especially in Nevada’s rural communities.

It’s our partnerships that can strengthen our state, keep us moving forward, and allow us to address the issues that matter most to Nevadans. We can build a healthier Nevada with greater opportunities for everyone. And it starts by listening.

I’m proud to represent the first state with a female-majority legislature & Supreme Court; & one of just a handful of states to be represented by two women in the U.S. Senate. We understand that our diversity is our strength. We understand that we all win when we work together.

I stand ready to work with the members of this committee and the rest of my colleagues in the Senate to find a sustainable solution that ensures all parties have a voice in this process.
The current bill before this committee continues on an unworkable path that only delays the country from finding a solution to our nuclear waste dilemma.
That is why @SenJackyRosen and I have introduced alternative legislation that guarantees every state has a seat at the table.
All we are asking today is that Nevada is treated fairly, that it is treated the same as every other state. Congress should not, and cannot, shove nuclear waste down our throats.
Numerous studies have also found that the groundwater  around the repository is at risk of contamination, affecting communities across Nevada and California.

The federal government has spent $19 billion with little to show in result. No waste handling facilities. No railroad infrastructure needed for transporting waste into the site. All that exists at Yucca Mountain is a five mile hole in the ground.
That is why Nevadans have been united in the fight to ensure that not an ounce of nuclear waste makes it to Yucca Mountain.
I ask you to put yourselves in the shoes of Nevadans. Imagine having nuclear waste sent to your communities without your input, without a fair process.

Many believe Yucca Mountain is settled science. That Yucca Mountain was selected through a reasoned and thorough process or that Yucca Mountain is already equipped to receive nuclear waste. Well, they are wrong.

For over 30 years, many in Congress have been trying to force a repository facility on Nevada, despite the fact that Nevada does not generate or consume nuclear energy, and that Yucca Mountain is a seismically and geologically unfit site to store this dangerous material.

This morning, @SenJackyRosen and I are bringing Nevadans' voices with us as we testify in opposition to a bill that tries to once again shove nuclear waste down the throat of Nevadans by restarting Yucca Mountain. WATCH live:  http://facebook.com/SenatorCortezMasto/ …

Ten years after the @Lilly_Ledbetter Fair Pay Act was signed into law by President Obama, I proudly cosponsored the #PaycheckFairness Act to strengthen our laws & bring us one step closer to finally closing the gender wage gap. #Ledbetter10

We can’t let this disparity, which is worse for women of color, continue to exist. The #PaycheckFairness Act would make necessary fixes to narrow the wage gap and ensure that American women earn a fair wage to support their families.

Equal pay for equal work means giving women the opportunity to achieve economic security and the ability to provide for their families. But in America, women still earn on average only about 80 percent of what men earn.

We should not be abdicating to the Executive Branch. We should be doing our job.
 
Let’s open this government. Let’s show these federal workers that they aren’t political pawns.

We know we can pass legislation to open the government. We did it in the last Congress. It’s the president’s decision whether to accept/veto. If he decides to veto it, we should override. The founders and framers set up a process so that no one branch of government has control.

The shutdown is threatening wildlife and public safety because staff are furloughed and federal contractors aren’t getting paid. Important projects are delayed and services Nevadans rely on have been halted.

This is only one of the major impacts on Nevadans. It’s not the only major disruption we’re seeing. I spoke today with Nevadans who work at the BLM, U.S. Fish and Wildlife, U.S. Geological Survey and USDA Rural Development.

A single mom told me that she recently moved to Nevada after getting her dream job. She used her savings to move and buy a house. Without the certainty of a paycheck, she asked me, “how do I pay the bills, support my mother and my 8-year-old?”

I spoke with parents who both work for the federal government and are not receiving any income. They have four children. Given the uncertainty of when the government will re-open, they have no idea how they could support their family without any pay.

The consensus I heard from federal workers is simple: re-open the government. Thousands of Nevada’s federal workers are worried about paying the bills, supporting their children and keeping up with their mortgage payments.
This morning, I’m going to hear from Nevadans whose families and finances are being thrown into chaos because of President Trump’s senseless shutdown. Follow along this thread for updates.

Along with @JerryMoran, we passed the Increased Aviation Safety through Contract Towers Act in the 115th Congress. Small, rural airports like the Boulder City Airport will become eligible for necessary safety improvement funding as a result of this legislation.

This bill would take @TxDPS Captain Prestige’s innovative Interdiction for the Protection of Children (IPC) program—which trains officers to recognize trafficking & exploitation—& bring it to law enforcement across the US.

It’s important that our law enforcement can recognize the signs of human trafficking& identify victims who may be hiding in plain sight. To help law enforcement find them, I've introduced the Interdiction for the Protection of Child Victims of Exploitation & Human Trafficking Act
